resources.string: Based on your current stock, if you get just one more ingredient, you can make these more recipes.
Your favorites need these ingredients that you don\'t have.
These ingredients show up most often in recipes. (This doesn\'t consider what you already have in your stock.)
Blend: Mix in an electric blender.
Build: Fill a glass with ice, and pour in ingredients.
Dash: A short squirt. Technically, 1/6th of a teaspoon.
Fill: Pour up to the top of the glass.
Float: Gently pour on top of a drink.
Layer: Gently add ingredients in layers. You may need a spoon to stop the fall of the pour. Do not stir.
Muddle: Crush ingredients to release flavors. Use a muddling device, or crush between thumb and ice cube or between spoon and glass side.
Rim: Moisten the glass\' rim and sprinkle on the outside. One could dunk the rim in a flat bed of a substance, but one must be careful not to overdo it. Subtle is better than cloying.
Splash: A long squirt. Technically, half an ounce.
Top: Add on top of other ingredients in serving glass. Do not stir.

Shake: A vigorous shaking of the mixing glass, usually with ice added. Shaking should be long enough that the contents become aerated and fizzy. Generally, the cold of the mixing glass should make your fingers sting.
Strain: Break open the mixing glass and let the liquid contents into the serving glass, keeping the ice in the mixing glass.
Pour: Break open the mixing glass and pour the entire contents into the serving glass, including any ice in it.
Using unfiltered view because you\'d see nothing after filtering.
There are no recipes producable with ingredients you\'ve indicated are stocked in your bar.
If you indicate more items stocked in your bar, you will see more recipes here. See shopping suggestions too.
* You lack an ingredient that recipe requires.
Enter the ingredients you own to see what recipes you can make with them. Hit Menu for help later.
This app was free. Care to buy the author a drink?
